metadata.name: Lexical Semantics & Lexicon
metadata.description: Word meaning, sense structure, and lexical relations.

entries.definition: The study of word meanings, sense distinctions, and relationships among words.
A distinct meaning associated with a word form in a particular context or usage.
An abstract unit of lexical meaning encompassing all inflected forms of a word.
The canonical dictionary form representing a lexeme.
A relation between words with similar meanings.
Partial synonymy where words differ in connotation, register, or usage.
A single word having multiple related meanings.
entries.notes: Polysemy explains why one word form can participate in multiple hyponymy relations.

entries.definition: The relationship between words that share a form but have unrelated meanings.
A word with a broad meaning that subsumes more specific words.
A word whose meaning is included within the meaning of a more general term.
examples: boil is a hyponym of cook
murder is a hyponym of kill
entries.notes: Hyponymy is many-to-one at the sense level.

entries.definition: A verb-specific subtype of hyponymy where the verb encodes manner of action.
entries.notes: Not all verb hyponyms are troponyms; manner must be specified.

entries.definition: A concept for which a language lacks a conventional word.
